english: to draw; painting; picture; to delineate

etymology.description: From 畵 with 𦘒 omitted; phono-semantic: semantic 聿 (brush) + phonetic 規.
etymology.interpretation: Built from the idea of a writing brush (聿) combined with the sound-providing element 規, conveying the act of making lines or drawings. The simplified form 画 streamlines the earlier 畫 while retaining the core notion of marking or delineating.
etymology.simplification: Stroke-reduction of 畫 by omitting 𦘒 and collapsing complex elements, standardized in the PRC; visual components were regularized to a simpler frame.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢画山水画(我喜歡畫山水畫)。
examples.english: I like to paint landscape paintings.

examples.chinese: 请你画一条直线(請你畫一條直線)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ huà yì tiáo zhíxiàn.

examples.chinese: 这幅画很有名(這幅畫很有名)。
